meanings.definition: To saw (wood) again, especially to produce thinner pieces.
meanings.sent1: He resawed the plank to make it thinner.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter resawed the log into smaller sections.
meanings.sent3: The lumberjack resawed the board and accidentally made it too thin.
meanings.sent4: She resawed the timber with precision, like a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the saw resawing the wood echoed through the workshop.
